{{Campaignbox Syrian uprising}}
  â   â
The '''Siege of Hama''', also known as the '''Ramadan Massacre''',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bikyamasr.com/wordpress/?p=38035 |title=At least 150 die in what Syrians dub âRamadan Massacreâ |publisher=Bikya Masr |date= |accessdate=1 August 2011}}</ref> occurred on 31 July 2011, primarily in the [[Syrian]] city of [[Hama]]. The [[government of Syria]] sent the [[Syrian army]] to Hama to control protests on the eve of [[Ramadan]]. Live ammunition was indiscriminately fired on the civilian population, along with tank and artillery fire.<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/07/201173143432348733.html 'Scores dead' as Syrian tanks storm Hama city - Middle East - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> At least 122 people have died, with 84 in Hama alone, and 29 in [[Deir ez-Zor]]. Hundreds more have been wounded.<ref>[http://www.dawn.com/2011/07/31/syrian-army-kills-at-least-95-in-hama-activist.html Syrian army kills at least 95 in Hama: activist | World | DAWN.COM<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.khaleejtimes.com/DisplayArticle09.asp?xfile=data/middleeast/2011/August/middleeast_August34.xml&section=middleeast Hama assault into second day, UN revives Syria debate]</ref> The crackdown has been the most intense of the [[2011 Syrian uprising]] so far, with already over 1,600 protesters and 500 members of the security forces killed since 15 March.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.962touchfm.co.uk/news/headlines/syria-24-civilians-killed-in-tank-attack-16040688/| title = Syria: 24 Civilians Killed In Tank Attack| accessdate=31 July 2011}}</ref>
  â   â
In a separate incident on the same day, political prisoners also attempted to mutiny in Hama's central prison, to which security forces responded with live ammunition. The death toll in the prison is unknown.<ref>http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2011/08/02/160464.html</ref> Eight policemen were also reported to had died in clashes in Hama.<ref>[http://www.thestarphoenix.com/story_print.html?id=5187856&sponsor= Syrian tanks bombard residential areas of Hama]</ref>
  â   â
==History==
  â
{{main|1964 Hama riot|April 1981 Hama massacre|Hama massacre}}
  â
Hama has been the epicenter of [[Syrian uprising]]s since the very event of the [[1963 Syrian coup d'Ã©tat|1963 Ba'athist coup]]. As early as 1964, a widescale [[1964 Hama riot|riot]], often described as [[1964 Hama riot|uprising]], broke in the city, and was violently suppressed by the military, resulting in more than 70 killed citizens. A much greater violence occured during the 1976-1982 [[Islamic uprising in Syria]], when hundreds of Hama citizens were executed in the [[April 1981 Hama massacre|April 1981 crackdown]]. In February 1982, a much larger scale [[Hama massacre|massacre]] took place in Hama, following an armed and organized [[Hama massacre|uprising of Islamic groups]], centered in the city. The 1982 Hama massacre claimed the lives of nearly 25,000 Hama citizens and Islamic militants and as many as 1,000 soldiers.
  â   â
